alert.note: Alert for Garfield; Petroleum (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 09 at 1:58PM MDT until June 10 at 11:09PM MDT by NWS Glasgow
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Glasgow MT has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Montana... Musselshell River at Mosby affecting Garfield and Petroleum Counties. For the Musselshell River...including Mosby...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO LATE TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Musselshell River at Mosby. * WHEN...From this afternoon to late tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 10.5 feet, Low land flooding begins. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:45 PM MDT Friday the stage was 10.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 1:45 PM MDT Friday was 10.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 11.0 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage late tonight. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 11.0 feet on 06/18/1997. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Saturday morning by 600 AM MDT.
